newsitem.title: USA: Fidelity Select Energy Service manager leaves.
newsitem.headline: Fidelity Select Energy Service manager leaves.

text.p: Fidelity Investments said on Friday that another Select fund manager has resigned from the company, making about a dozen Select fund managers who have left this year.
Dan Pickering, who managed the $380 million Select Energy Service and the $300 million Select Food & Agriculture funds, has left the company, Fidelity spokeswoman Robyn Tice said.
Tice had no further information on Pickering's future plans. Pickering, 30, who joined the fund company in 1994, previously managed the Select Natural Gas fund.
